post.text: When Trump trivializes the sacrifice of our military and veterans, he makes it clear: He has no idea what service to this country means.

comment.author: Cassyl
comment.text: As a military man, I need to know how you could possibly defend Trump from such an ignorant stance and still think he could be the Commander-In-Chief of one of the most powerful nations in the world. Kayla

replies.author: Kayla
replies.text: I do not defend Trumps stupid/ignorant comments, but I do condemn Hillary's actions. I'll vote for Trump because he's not a career criminal like she is and he doesn't have American blood on his hands like she does. As a soldier who's been in combat and has seen the horrors of war I will NEVER be ok with what Hillary did in Benghazi NEVER. I care more about that than what Trump said. Plain and simple! So you can seat there and bring bs like this all day long, at the end of the day he is the better candidate of them both. You're outraged by Trump's words but not by Hillary's actions. That's what's wrong with this country. It says a lot about who you are as a person and what you stand for if you vote and support a lying criminal like her.

replies.author: Cassyl
replies.text: I never said I am with her or voting for her. Just so that's clear. There were other candidates available, people chose the worst two to move forward. It leaves me in awe.
